meanings.sent1: The bird overflies the tall trees in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The plane overflies the city on its way to the next destination.
meanings.sent3: The superhero overflies the city, keeping a watchful eye on its inhabitants.
meanings.sent4: Time overflies us like a swift bird, never pausing for a moment.
meanings.sent5: The eagle overflies its prey, ready to swoop down for a catch.

meanings.sent1: The clouds overflies the mountain, casting shadows below.
meanings.sent2: The migrating birds overflies the fields in search of warmer climates.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel overflies the fence, escaping into the neighbor's yard.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter overflies any sadness, bringing joy to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The river overflies its banks during heavy rains, causing flooding in the area.

meanings.definition: To surpass in flight or speed
meanings.sent1: The champion racehorse overflies its competitors, reaching the finish line first.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah overflies all other land animals in terms of speed.
meanings.sent3: The spaceship overflies any aircraft in terms of altitude and speed.
meanings.sent4: His determination overflies any obstacles in his path to success.
meanings.sent5: The falcon overflies all other birds with its incredible speed and agility.
